definitions.definition: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
examples: He drank the water I gave him.
You can lead a horse to water but you can't make him drink .

definitions.definition: To consume the liquid contained within (a bottle, glass, etc.).
examples: Jack drank the whole bottle by himself.
Everyone who is drinking is drinking, but not everyone who is drinking is drinking .

definitions.definition: To take in (a liquid), in any manner; to suck up; to absorb; to imbibe.
To take in; to receive within one, through the senses; to inhale; to hear; to see.
To toast (someone or something) with a drink, honour ; to wish well (see drink to ), especially:

subdefinitions.definition: To express one's desire for the accomplishment of a toast, sentiment or event, to wish , hope (for), forward (especially as 'to drink the health (of someone)').

definitions.definition: Used in phrasal verbs: drink down , drink in , drink off , drink out , drink to , drink up .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , metonymic ) To consume the liquid contained within (a bottle, glass, etc.).
( transitive ) To take in (a liquid), in any manner; to suck up; to absorb; to imbibe.
( transitive ) To take in; to receive within one, through the senses; to inhale; to hear; to see.
( transitive , archaic ) To toast (someone or something) with a drink, honour ; to wish well (see drink to ), especially:
( transitive , obsolete ) To smoke , as tobacco .
Used in phrasal verbs: drink down , drink in , drink off , drink out , drink to , drink up .
